creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture
description: balding figure with white beard, white wings, and long, beaklike nose standig at the edge of a steep cliff scratching head with PR hand; inscription ULQ
inscription:
Signature, Inscription, and Seals

ULQ: [In the mid-summer of 1817 a group of crazy fools traveled to Daihikaku in Arashiyama. one [sic.] of us fools looked out over the cliff but dared not jump, so I painted this picture to present to him] (AS)
markings: top center, rectangular relief; UL edge, rectangular intaglio: [Shugu]; UL edge, square intaglio: [Chikuto]
title: Cowardly Tengu
